item.title: Urban Trail Cam
item.description: Last year, my father-in-law got a trail cam at my suggestion – mainly to get pictures of the rats that were eating his compost. It worked: I borrowed it a while back, and finally set it up today under our bird feeder to see what we could get. Not a bad haul! We got: Spotted towhees: Dark-eyed juncos: Black and grey squirrels: A chickadee: Not bad!

item.title: Dishwasher Loading Critic
item.description: My project: critiquing your dishwasher loading technique using machine learning. A work in progress. You can find the repo here.

item.title: Fast Ai and Pytorch
item.description: I’ve been interested in machine learning for a while now. Like a lot of things, my approach has been a bit scattered. I’m slowly learning how to get better at that, but I still tend to veer around. A couple of months ago, I decided to take the Fast.ai course again. I had done a couple of lessons a year ago, but had not followed it up. This time around, I saw that they not only had a new version of the course, but a book as well.
